   20: -module(inet_SUITE).

   24: -include_lib("kernel/src/inet_res.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("kernel/src/inet_dns.hrl").
   26: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   27: 
   28: -export([
   29:          all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   30:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   31: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   32:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   33: 
   34: 	 t_gethostbyaddr/0, t_gethostbyaddr/1,
   35: 	 t_getaddr/0, t_getaddr/1,
   36: 	 t_gethostbyname/0, t_gethostbyname/1, t_gethostbyname_empty/1,
   37: 	 t_gethostbyaddr_v6/0, t_gethostbyaddr_v6/1,
   38: 	 t_getaddr_v6/0, t_getaddr_v6/1,
   39: 	 t_gethostbyname_v6/0, t_gethostbyname_v6/1,
   40: 	 ipv4_to_ipv6/0, ipv4_to_ipv6/1,
   41: 	 host_and_addr/0, host_and_addr/1,
   42: 	 t_gethostnative/1, 
   43: 	 gethostnative_parallell/1, cname_loop/1,
   44:          missing_hosts_reload/1, hosts_file_quirks/1,
   45:          gethostnative_soft_restart/0, gethostnative_soft_restart/1,
   46: 	 gethostnative_debug_level/0, gethostnative_debug_level/1,
   47: 	 lookup_bad_search_option/1,
   48: 	 getif/1,
   49: 	 getif_ifr_name_overflow/1,getservbyname_overflow/1, getifaddrs/1,
   50: 	 is_ip_address/1,
   51: 	 parse_strict_address/1, ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address/1, ntoa/1,
   52:          simple_netns/1, simple_netns_open/1,
   53:          add_del_host/1, add_del_host_v6/1,
   54:          simple_bind_to_device/1, simple_bind_to_device_open/1,
   55: 	 socknames_sctp/1, socknames_tcp/1, socknames_udp/1
   56:         ]).
   57: 
   58: -export([
   59:          get_hosts/1, get_ipv6_hosts/1, parse_hosts/1, parse_address/1,
   60: 	 kill_gethost/0, parallell_gethost/0, test_netns/0
   61:         ]).
   62: 
   63: 
   64: 
   65: suite() ->
   66:     [
   67:      {ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   68:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}
   69:     ].
   70: 
   71: all() -> 
   72:     [
   73:      t_gethostbyaddr, t_gethostbyname, t_gethostbyname_empty, t_getaddr,
   74:      t_gethostbyaddr_v6, t_gethostbyname_v6, t_getaddr_v6,
   75:      ipv4_to_ipv6, host_and_addr, is_ip_address, {group, parse},
   76:      t_gethostnative, gethostnative_parallell, cname_loop,
   77:      missing_hosts_reload, hosts_file_quirks,
   78:      gethostnative_debug_level, gethostnative_soft_restart,
   79:      lookup_bad_search_option,
   80:      getif, getif_ifr_name_overflow, getservbyname_overflow,
   81:      getifaddrs, parse_strict_address, ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address, ntoa,
   82:      simple_netns, simple_netns_open,
   83:      add_del_host, add_del_host_v6,
   84:      simple_bind_to_device, simple_bind_to_device_open,
   85:      {group, socknames}
   86:     ].
   87: 
   88: groups() -> 
   89:     [
   90:      {parse,     [], parse_cases()},
   91:      {socknames, [], socknames_cases()}
   92:     ].
   93: 
   94: parse_cases() ->
   95:     [
   96:      parse_hosts,
   97:      parse_address
   98:     ].
   99: 
  100: socknames_cases() ->
  101:     [
  102:      socknames_sctp,
  103:      socknames_tcp,
  104:      socknames_udp
  105:     ].
  106: 
  107: %% Required configuration
  108: required(v4) ->
  109:     [{require, test_host_ipv4_only},
  110:      {require, test_dummy_host}];
  111: required(v6) ->
  112:     [{require, test_host_ipv6_only},
  113:      {require, test_dummy_ipv6_host}];
  114: required(hosts) ->
  115:     case os:type() of
  116: 	{OS, _} when OS =:= win32 ->
  117: 	    [{require, hardcoded_hosts},
  118: 	     {require, hardcoded_ipv6_hosts}];
  119: 	_Else ->
  120: 	    [{require, test_hosts}]
  121:     end.     
  122: 
  123: 
  124: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  125: 
  126:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  127:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  128:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  129: 
  130:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite([{allow_skip, false} | Config0]) of
  131:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  132:             SKIP;
  133: 
  134:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  135:             
  136:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  137:             ?P("init_per_suite -> try start system monitor"),
  138:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  139: 
  140:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  141:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  142: 
  143:             Config1
  144:     end.
  145: 
  146: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  147: 
  148:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  149:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  150:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  151: 
  152:     %% Stop the local monitor
  153:     ?P("init_per_suite -> try stop system monitor"),
  154:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  155: 
  156:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  157: 
  158:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  159:             "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  160: 
  161:     Config1.
  162: 
  163: 
  164: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  165:     Config.
  166: 
  167: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  168:     Config.
  169: 
  170: 
  171: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) ->
  172:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  173:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  174:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  175:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  176:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  177:        [Config0, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  178: 
  179:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  180: 
  181:     Config1 = init_per_testcase2(Case, Config0),
  182: 
  183:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  184:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  185:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  186:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  187:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [Config1, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  188:     Config1.
  189: 
  190: init_per_testcase2(gethostnative_debug_level, Config) ->
  191:     ?TT(?MINS(2)),
  192:     Config;
  193: init_per_testcase2(gethostnative_soft_restart, Config) ->
  194:     ?TT(?MINS(2)),
  195:     Config;
  196: init_per_testcase2(lookup_bad_search_option, Config) ->
  197:     Db = inet_db,
  198:     Key = res_lookup,
  199:     %% The bad option cannot enter through inet_db:set_lookup/1,
  200:     %% but through e.g .inetrc.
  201:     Prev = ets:lookup(Db, Key),
  202:     ets:delete(Db, Key),
  203:     ets:insert(Db, {Key,[lookup_bad_search_option]}),
  204:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> Misconfigured resolver lookup order"),
  205:     [{Key,Prev}|Config];
  206: init_per_testcase2(_Func, Config) ->
  207:     Config.
  208: 
  209: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  210:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  211:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  212:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  213:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  214:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  215:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  216: 
  217:     ?P("system events during test: "
  218:        "~n   ~p", [kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  219: 
  220:     end_per_testcase2(Case, Config),
  221: 
  222:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  223:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  224:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  225:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  226:     ok.
  227: 
  228: end_per_testcase2(lookup_bad_search_option, Config) ->
  229:     ?P("end_per_testcase2 -> restore resolver lookup order"),
  230:     Db   = inet_db,
  231:     Key  = res_lookup,
  232:     Prev = proplists:get_value(Key, Config),
  233:     ets:delete(Db, Key),
  234:     ets:insert(Db, Prev),
  235:     ?P("end_per_testcase2 -> resolver lookup order restored");
  236: end_per_testcase2(_Func, _Config) ->
  237:     ok.
  238: 
  239: t_gethostbyaddr() -> required(v4).
  240: %% Test the inet:gethostbyaddr/1 function.
  241: t_gethostbyaddr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  242:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_gethostbyaddr(Config) end).
  243: 
  244: do_gethostbyaddr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     ?P("begin - try get config 'test_host_ipv4_only'"),
  246:     {Name,FullName,IPStr,{A,B,C,D}=IP,Aliases,_,_} =
  247:         ct:get_config(test_host_ipv4_only),
  248:     ?P("config 'test_host_ipv4_only': "
  249:        "~n   Name:      ~p"
  250:        "~n   Full Name: ~p"
  251:        "~n   IPStr:     ~p"
  252:        "~n   (IP) A:    ~p"
  253:        "~n   (IP) B:    ~p"
  254:        "~n   (IP) C:    ~p"
  255:        "~n   (IP) D:    ~p"
  256:        "~n   Aliases:   ~p",
  257:        [Name, FullName, IPStr, A, B, C, D,Aliases]),
  258:     Rname = integer_to_list(D) ++ "." ++
  259: 	integer_to_list(C) ++ "." ++
  260: 	integer_to_list(B) ++ "." ++
  261: 	integer_to_list(A) ++ ".in-addr.arpa",
  262:     {ok, HEnt} = inet:gethostbyaddr(IPStr),
  263:     {ok, HEnt} = inet:gethostbyaddr(IP),
  264:     ?P("gethostbyaddr for (both):"
  265:        "~n   IPStr: ~p"
  266:        "~n   IP:    ~p"
  267:        "~n   => ~p", [IPStr, IP, HEnt]),
  268:     {error, Reason} = inet:gethostbyaddr(Name),
  269:     ok = ?P("Expected error with failure reason: "
  270:             "~n   (~w) ~s", [Reason, inet:format_error(Reason)]),
  271:     HEnt_ = HEnt#hostent{h_addrtype = inet,
  272:                          h_length = 4,
  273:                          h_addr_list = [IP]},
  274:     HEnt_ = HEnt,
  275:     case {os:type(),os:version()} of
  276:         {{unix,freebsd},{5,0,0}} ->
  277:             %% The alias list seems to be buggy in FreeBSD 5.0.0.
  278:             check_elems([{HEnt#hostent.h_name,[Name,FullName]}]),
  279:             ?P("Buggy alias list: ~p", [HEnt#hostent.h_aliases]),
  280:             ok;
  281:         _ ->
  282:             ?P("alias list: "
  283:                "~n   ~p", [HEnt#hostent.h_aliases]),
  284:             ?P("check alias list: "
  285:                "~n   ~p", [[Aliases,tl(Aliases),[Rname]]]),
  286:             ?P("name:       ~p", [HEnt#hostent.h_name]),
  287:             ?P("check name: ~p", [[Name,FullName]]),
  288:             check_elems(
  289: 	      [{HEnt#hostent.h_name,[Name,FullName]},
  290: 	       {HEnt#hostent.h_aliases,[[],Aliases,tl(Aliases),[Rname]]}])
  291:     end,
  292: 
  293:     ?P("try get config 'test_dummy_host'"),
  294:     {_DName, _DFullName, DIPStr, DIP, _, _, _} = ct:get_config(test_dummy_host),
  295:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyaddr(DIPStr),
  296:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyaddr(DIP),
  297: 
  298:     ?P("done"),
  299:     ok.
  300: 
  301: t_gethostbyaddr_v6() -> required(v6).
  302: %% Test the inet:gethostbyaddr/1 inet6 function.
  303: t_gethostbyaddr_v6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_gethostbyaddr_v6(Config) end).
  305: 
  306: do_gethostbyaddr_v6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  307:     {Name6, FullName6, IPStr6, IP6, Aliases6} =
  308: 	ct:get_config(test_host_ipv6_only),
  309: 
  310:     case inet:gethostbyaddr(IPStr6) of
  311:         %% Even if IPv6 is not supported, the native resolver may succeed
  312: 	%% looking up the host. DNS lookup will probably fail.
  313: 	{error,nxdomain} ->
  314: 	    {skip, "IPv6 test fails! IPv6 not supported on this host!?"};
  315: 	{ok, HEnt6} ->
  316: 	    {ok, HEnt6} = inet:gethostbyaddr(IP6),
  317: 	    {error, Reason6} = inet:gethostbyaddr(Name6),
  318: 	    ok = ?P("Expected error with failure reason: "
  319:                     "~n   (~w) ~s", [Reason6, inet:format_error(Reason6)]),
  320: 	    HEnt6_ = HEnt6#hostent{h_addrtype = inet6,
  321: 				   h_length = 16,
  322: 				   h_addr_list = [IP6]},
  323: 	    HEnt6_ = HEnt6,
  324: 	    check_elems(
  325: 	      [{HEnt6#hostent.h_name,[Name6,FullName6]},
  326: 	       {HEnt6#hostent.h_aliases,[[],Aliases6,tl(Aliases6)]}]),
  327: 
  328: 	    {_DName6, _DFullName6, DIPStr6, DIP6, _} =
  329: 		ct:get_config(test_dummy_ipv6_host),
  330: 	    {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyaddr(DIPStr6),
  331: 	    {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyaddr(DIP6),
  332: 	    ok
  333:     end.
  334: 
  335: t_gethostbyname() -> required(v4).
  336: %% Test the inet:gethostbyname/1 function.
  337: t_gethostbyname(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  338:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_gethostbyname(Config) end).
  339: 
  340: do_gethostbyname(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  341:     {Name,FullName,IPStr,IP,Aliases,IP_46_Str,_} =
  342: 	ct:get_config(test_host_ipv4_only),
  343:     {ok,_} = inet:gethostbyname(IPStr),
  344:     {ok,HEnt} = inet:gethostbyname(Name),
  345:     {ok,HEnt} = inet:gethostbyname(list_to_atom(Name)),
  346:     HEnt_ = HEnt#hostent{h_addrtype = inet,
  347: 			 h_length = 4,
  348: 			 h_addr_list = [IP]},
  349: 
  350:     HEnt_ = HEnt,
  351:     check_elems([{HEnt#hostent.h_name,[Name,FullName]},
  352: 		 {HEnt#hostent.h_aliases,[[],Aliases,tl(Aliases)]}]),
  353:     {ok,HEntF} = inet:gethostbyname(FullName),
  354:     HEntF_ = HEntF#hostent{h_name = FullName,
  355: 			   h_addrtype = inet,
  356: 			   h_length = 4,
  357: 			   h_addr_list = [IP]},
  358:     HEntF_ = HEntF,
  359:     check_elems([{HEnt#hostent.h_aliases,[[],Aliases,tl(Aliases)]}]),
  360:     %%
  361:     FullNameU = toupper(FullName),
  362:     {ok,HEntU} = inet:gethostbyname(FullNameU),
  363:     FullNameU = toupper(HEntU#hostent.h_name),
  364:     #hostent{
  365:        h_addrtype = inet,
  366:        h_length = 4,
  367:        h_addr_list = [IP]} = HEntU,
  368:     check_elems(
  369:       [{[toupper(H) || H <- HEntU#hostent.h_aliases],
  370: 	[[],[toupper(A) || A <- Aliases]]}]),
  371: 
  372:     {DName, _DFullName, _DIPStr, _DIP, _, _, _} =
  373: 	ct:get_config(test_dummy_host),
  374:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyname(DName),
  375:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyname(IP_46_Str),
  376:     ok.
  377: 
  378: 
  379: t_gethostbyname_empty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  380:     element(1, os:type()) =:= unix andalso
  381:         begin
  382:             {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyname(""),
  383:             {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyname('')
  384:         end,
  385:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyname("."),
  386:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:gethostbyname('.'),
  387:     ok.
  388: 
  389: 
  390: t_gethostbyname_v6() -> required(v6).
  391: %% Test the inet:gethostbyname/1 inet6 function.
  392: t_gethostbyname_v6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  393:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_gethostbyname_v6(Config) end).
  394: 
  395: do_gethostbyname_v6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  396:     {Name, FullName, IPStr, IP, Aliases} =
  397: 	ct:get_config(test_host_ipv6_only),
  398: 
  399:     case inet:gethostbyname(Name, inet6) of
  400: 	{ok,HEnt} ->
  401: 	    {ok,_} = inet:gethostbyname(IPStr, inet6),
  402: 	    {ok,HEnt} = inet:gethostbyname(list_to_atom(Name), inet6),
  403: 	    case HEnt#hostent.h_addr_list of
  404: 		[IP] -> % IPv6 address
  405: 		    #hostent{h_addrtype = inet6,
  406: 			     h_length = 16} = HEnt,
  407: 		    check_elems(
  408: 		      [{HEnt#hostent.h_name,[Name,FullName]},
  409: 		       {HEnt#hostent.h_aliases,[[],Aliases,tl(Aliases)]}]);
  410: 		[IP46] -> % IPv4 compatible address
  411: 		    {ok,HEnt4} = inet:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
  412: 		    #hostent{h_addrtype = inet,
  413: 			     h_length = 4,
  414: 			     h_addr_list = [IP4]} = HEnt4,
  415: 		    {ok,IP46} =
  416: 			inet_parse:ipv6_address(
  417: 			  "::ffff:" ++ inet:ntoa(IP4)),
  418: 		    check_elems(
  419: 		      [{HEnt#hostent.h_name,[Name,FullName]}])
  420: 	    end,
  421: 
  422: 	    {ok,HEntF} = inet:gethostbyname(FullName, inet6),
  423: 	    case HEntF#hostent.h_addr_list of
  424: 		[IP] -> % IPv6 address
  425: 		    #hostent{h_name = FullName,
  426: 			     h_addrtype = inet6,
  427: 			     h_length = 16} = HEntF,
  428: 		    check_elems(
  429: 		      [{HEnt#hostent.h_aliases,[[],Aliases,tl(Aliases)]}]);
  430: 		[IP46F] -> % IPv4 compatible address
  431: 		    {ok,HEnt4F} = inet:gethostbyname(FullName, inet),
  432: 		    #hostent{h_addrtype = inet,
  433: 			     h_length = 4,
  434: 			     h_addr_list = [IP4F]} = HEnt4F,
  435: 		    {ok,IP46F} =
  436: 			inet_parse:ipv6_address(
  437: 			  "::ffff:" ++ inet:ntoa(IP4F)),
  438: 		    check_elems(
  439: 		      [{HEntF#hostent.h_name,[Name,FullName]}])
  440: 	    end;
  441: 	_ ->
  442: 	    {skip, "IPv6 is not supported on this host"}
  443:     end.
  444: 
  445: check_elems([{Val,Tests} | Elems]) ->
  446:     ?P("check_elems -> entry with"
  447:        "~n   Val:   ~p"
  448:        "~n   Tests: ~p", [Val, Tests]),
  449:     check_elem(Val, Tests, Tests),
  450:     check_elems(Elems);
  451: check_elems([]) -> ok.
  452: 
  453: check_elem(Val, [Val|_], _) -> ok;
  454: check_elem(Val, [_|Tests], Tests0) ->
  455:     check_elem(Val, Tests, Tests0);
  456: check_elem(Val, [], Tests0) ->
  457:     ct:fail({no_match,Val,Tests0}).
  458: 
  459: 
  460: t_getaddr() -> required(v4).
  461: %% Test the inet:getaddr/2 function.
  462: t_getaddr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  463:     {Name,FullName,IPStr,IP,_,IP_46_Str,IP46} =
  464: 	ct:get_config(test_host_ipv4_only),
  465:     {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(list_to_atom(Name), inet),
  466:     {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(Name, inet),
  467:     {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(FullName, inet),
  468:     {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(IP, inet),
  469:     {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(IPStr, inet),
  470:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:getaddr(IP_46_Str, inet),
  471:     {error,eafnosupport} = inet:getaddr(IP46, inet),
  472: 
  473:     {DName, DFullName, DIPStr, DIP, _, _, _} = ct:get_config(test_dummy_host),
  474:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:getaddr(DName, inet),
  475:     {error,nxdomain} = inet:getaddr(DFullName, inet),
  476:     {ok,DIP} = inet:getaddr(DIPStr, inet),
  477:     {ok,DIP} = inet:getaddr(DIP, inet),
  478:     ok.
  479: 
  480: t_getaddr_v6() -> required(v4) ++ required(v6).
  481: %% Test the inet:getaddr/2 function.
  482: t_getaddr_v6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  483:     {Name,FullName,IPStr,IP,_} =
  484: 	ct:get_config(test_host_ipv6_only),
  485: 
  486:     case inet:getaddr(Name, inet6) of
  487: 	{ok,Addr} ->
  488: 	    IP = Addr,
  489: 	    {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(toupper(Name), inet6),
  490: 	    {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(list_to_atom(Name), inet6),
  491: 	    {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(list_to_atom(toupper(Name)), inet6),
  492: 	    {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(FullName, inet6),
  493: 	    {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(toupper(FullName), inet6),
  494: 	    {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(IP, inet6),
  495: 	    {ok,IP} = inet:getaddr(IPStr, inet6),
  496: 	    %%
  497: 	    {DName,DFullName,DIPStr,DIP,_} =
  498: 		ct:get_config(test_dummy_ipv6_host),
  499: 	    {error,nxdomain} = inet:getaddr(DName, inet6),
  500: 	    {error,nxdomain} = inet:getaddr(DFullName, inet6),
  501: 	    {ok,DIP} = inet:getaddr(DIPStr, inet6),
  502: 	    {ok,DIP} = inet:getaddr(DIP, inet6),
  503: 	    ok;
  504: 	_ ->
  505:  	    {skip, "IPv6 is not supported on this host"}
  506:     end.
  507: 
  508: ipv4_to_ipv6() -> required(v4).
  509: %% Test if IPv4 address is converted to IPv6 address.
  510: ipv4_to_ipv6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     %% Test what happens if an IPv4 address is looked up in an IPv6 context.
  512:     %% If the native resolver succeeds to look it up, an IPv4 compatible
  513:     %% address should be returned. If no IPv6 support on this host, an
  514:     %% error should beturned.
  515:     {_Name,_FullName,IPStr,_IP,Aliases,IP_46_Str,IP_46} =
  516: 	ct:get_config(test_host_ipv4_only),
  517:     IP4to6Res =
  518: 	case inet:getaddr(IPStr, inet6) of
  519: 	    {ok,IP_46} ->
  520: 		io:format("IPv4->IPv6: success~n"),
  521: 		true;
  522: 	    E = {error,nxdomain} ->
  523: 		io:format("IPv4->IPv6: nxdomain~n"),
  524: 		E;
  525: 	    E = {error,eafnosupport} ->
  526: 		io:format("IPv6->IPv4: eafnosupport~n"),
  527: 		E;
  528: 	    Other ->
  529: 		ct:fail({ipv4_to_ipv6_lookup_failed,Other})
  530: 	end,
  531:     case {IP4to6Res,inet:gethostbyname(IPStr, inet6)} of
  532: 	{true,{ok,HEnt}} ->
  533: 	    HEnt_ = HEnt#hostent{h_addrtype = inet6,
  534: 				 h_length = 16,
  535: 				 h_addr_list = [IP_46]},
  536: 	    HEnt_ = HEnt,
  537: 	    check_elems([{HEnt#hostent.h_name,[IP_46_Str,IPStr]},
  538: 			 {HEnt#hostent.h_aliases,[[],Aliases,tl(Aliases)]}]);
  539: 	{_,IP4to6Res} -> ok
  540:     end,
  541:     ok.
  542: 
  543: 
  544: %% Test looking up hosts and addresses. Use 'ypcat hosts'
  545: %% or the local equivalent to find all hosts.
  546: 
  547: host_and_addr() ->
  548:     ?P("host_and_addr -> entry"),
  549:     [{timetrap,{minutes,5}}|required(hosts)].
  550: 
  551: host_and_addr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  552:     do_host_and_addr(get_hosts(Config)).
  553: 
  554: do_host_and_addr(Hosts) when is_list(Hosts) andalso (Hosts =/= []) ->
  555:     lists:foreach(fun try_host/1, Hosts),
  556:     ok;
  557: do_host_and_addr(Hosts) ->
  558:     exit({skip, {no_valid_hosts, Hosts}}).
  559: 
  560: 
  561: try_host({Ip0, Host}) ->
  562:     {ok, Ip}                             = inet:getaddr(Ip0, inet),
  563:     {ok,{hostent, _, _, inet, _, Ips1}}  = inet:gethostbyaddr(Ip),
  564:     {ok,{hostent, _, _, inet, _, _Ips2}} = inet:gethostbyname(Host),
  565:     true = lists:member(Ip, Ips1),
  566:     ok.
  567: 
  568: %% Get all hosts from the system using 'ypcat hosts' or the local
  569: %% equvivalent.
  570: 
  571: get_hosts(_Config) -> 
  572:     case os:type() of
  573: 	{unix, _} ->
  574: 	    List = lists:map(fun(X) ->
  575: 				     atom_to_list(X)++" "
  576: 			     end, ct:get_config(test_hosts)),
  577: 	    Cmd = "ypmatch "++List++" hosts.byname", 
  578: 	    HostFile = os:cmd(Cmd),
  579: 	    get_hosts(HostFile, [], [], []);
  580: 	_ -> 
  581: 	    ct:get_config(hardcoded_hosts)
  582:     end.
  583: 
  584: get_ipv6_hosts(_Config) -> 
  585:     case os:type() of
  586: 	{unix, _} ->
  587: 	    List = lists:map(fun(X) ->
  588: 				     atom_to_list(X)++" "
  589: 			     end, ct:get_config(ipv6_hosts)),
  590: 	    Cmd = "ypmatch "++List++" ipnodes.byname", 
  591: 	    HostFile = os:cmd(Cmd),
  592: 	    get_hosts(HostFile, [], [], []);
  593: 	_ -> 
  594: 	    ct:get_config(hardcoded_ipv6_hosts)
  595:     end.
  596: 
  597: get_hosts([$\t|Rest], Cur, Ip, Result) when Ip /= [] ->
  598:     get_hosts(Rest, Cur, Ip, Result);
  599: get_hosts([$\t|Rest], Cur, _Ip, Result) ->
  600:     get_hosts(Rest, [], lists:reverse(Cur), Result);
  601: get_hosts([$\r|Rest], Cur, Ip, Result) ->
  602:     get_hosts(Rest, Cur, Ip, Result);
  603: get_hosts([$\n|Rest], Cur, Ip, Result) ->
  604:     [First|_] = string:tokens(lists:reverse(Cur), " "),
  605:     Ips = string:tokens(Ip, ","),
  606:     Hosts = [{I, First} || I <- Ips],
  607:     get_hosts(Rest, [], [], Hosts++Result);
  608: get_hosts([C|Rest], Cur, Ip, Result) ->
  609:     get_hosts(Rest, [C|Cur], Ip, Result);
  610: get_hosts([], _, _, Result) ->
  611:     Result.
  612: 
  613: 
  614: parse_hosts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  615:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  616:     HostFile = filename:join(DataDir, "hosts"),
  617:     inet_parse:hosts(HostFile),
  618:     HostFileErr1 = filename:join(DataDir, "hosts_err1"),
  619:     inet_parse:hosts(HostFileErr1),
  620:     Resolv = filename:join(DataDir,"resolv.conf"),
  621:     inet_parse:resolv(Resolv),
  622:     ResolvErr1 = filename:join(DataDir,"resolv.conf.err1"),
  623:     inet_parse:resolv(ResolvErr1).
  624: 
  625: parse_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  626:     V4Reversable =
  627: 	[{{0,0,0,0},"0.0.0.0"},
  628:          {{1,2,3,4},"1.2.3.4"},
  629: 	 {{253,252,251,250},"253.252.251.250"},
  630: 	 {{1,2,255,254},"1.2.255.254"}],
  631:     V6Reversable =
  632: 	[{{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0},"::"},
  633: 	 {{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1},"::1"},
  634: 	 {{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,2},"::0.0.0.2"},

  636: 	 {{15,16#f11,0,0,0,0,256,2},"f:f11::100:2"},

  638: 	 {{0,0,0,0,0,0,2,1},"::0.2.0.1"},
  639: 	 {{0,0,0,0,0,3,2,1},"::3:2:1"},
  640: 	 {{0,0,0,0,4,3,2,1},"::4:3:2:1"},

  695: 	  "c11::55c0:c66c:77:88"},
  696: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,0,0,0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  697: 	  "c11:c22::c66c:77:88"},
