  699: 	  "c11:c22:5c33::77:88"},
  700: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,16#c440,0,0,0,16#88},
  701: 	  "c11:c22:5c33:c440::88"},
  702: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,16#c440,16#55c0,0,0,0},
  703: 	  "c11:c22:5c33:c440:55c0::"},
  704: 	 {{0,0,0,0,16#55c0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  705: 	  "::55c0:c66c:77:88"},
  706: 	 {{16#c11,0,0,0,0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  707: 	  "c11::c66c:77:88"},
  708: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,0,0,0,0,16#77,16#88},
  709: 	  "c11:c22::77:88"},
  710: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,0,0,0,0,16#88},
  711: 	  "c11:c22:5c33::88"},
  712: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,16#c440,0,0,0,0},
  713: 	  "c11:c22:5c33:c440::"},
  714: 	 {{0,0,0,0,0,16#c66c,16#77,16#88},
  715: 	  "::c66c:77:88"},
  716: 	 {{16#c11,0,0,0,0,0,16#77,16#88},
  717: 	  "c11::77:88"},
  718: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,0,0,0,0,0,16#88},
  719: 	  "c11:c22::88"},
  720: 	 {{16#c11,16#c22,16#5c33,0,0,0,0,0},
  721: 	  "c11:c22:5c33::"},
  722: 	 {{0,0,0,0,0,65535,258,65534},"::ffff:1.2.255.254"},
  723:          {{16#fe80,12345,0,0,0,0,0,16#12},"fe80::12%012345"},
  724: 	 {{16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff,16#ffff},
  725: 	  "ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff"}
  726:          |[{list_to_tuple(P++[(D1 bsl 8) bor D2,(D3 bsl 8) bor D4]),
  727:             Q++S}
  728:            || {{D1,D2,D3,D4},S} <-
  729:                   tl(V4Reversable),
  730:               {P,Q} <-
  731:                   [{[0,0,0,0,0,16#ffff],"::ffff:"},
  732:                    {[0,0,0,0,0,0],"::"}]]],
  733:     V4Sloppy =
  734: 	[{{10,1,16#98,16#76},"10.0x019876"},
  735: 	 {{8#12,1,8#130,8#321},"012.01.054321"},
  736: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"252.253.254.0377"},
  737: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"0Xfc.000000000375.0x0000fe.255"},
  738: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"252.253.65279"},
  739: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"252.0xFD.0177377"},
  740: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"252.16645887"},
  741: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"00374.0XFDFEFF"},
  742: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"4244504319"},
  743: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"0xfcfdfeff"},
  744: 	 {{252,253,254,255},"00000000000037477377377"},
  745: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12345678"},
  746: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0x345678"},
  747: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0X34.0x5678"},
  748: 	 {{16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78},"0x12.0X34.0x56.0X78"},
  749: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0"},
  750: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"00"},
  751: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0"},
  752: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"00.00.00"},
  753: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.00.0.0"},
  754: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0.000000000000.0"}],
  755:     V6Sloppy =
  756:         [{{16#a,16#b,16#c,16#0,16#0,16#d,16#e,16#f},"A:B:C::d:e:f"},
  757:          {{16#fe80,0,0,0,0,0,0,16#12},"fe80::12%XXXXXXX"}]
  758:         ++
  759:         [{{P,0,0,0,0,D2,(D1 bsl 8) bor D2,(D3 bsl 8) bor D4},
  760:           Q++erlang:integer_to_list(D2, 16)++":"++S}
  761:          || {{D1,D2,D3,D4},S} <- V4Reversable,
  762:             {P,Q} <-
  763:                 [{16#2001,"2001::"},{16#177,"177::"},{16#ff0,"Ff0::"}]],
  764:     V4Err =
  765: 	["0.256.0.1",
  766: 	 "1.2.3.4.5",
  767: 	 "256.255.65535",
  768: 	 "4294967296",
  769: 	 "0x100000000",
  770: 	 "040000000000",
  771: 	 "1.2.3.-4",
  772: 	 "1.2.-3.4",
  773: 	 "1.-2.3.4",
  774: 	 "-1.2.3.4",
  775: 	 "10.",
  776: 	 "172.16.",
  777: 	 "198.168.0.",
  778: 	 "127.0.0.1."],
  779:     V6Err =
  780: 	[":::",
  781: 	 "f:::2",
  782: 	 "::-1",
  783: 	 "::g",
  784: 	 "f:f11::10100:2",
  785: 	 "f:f11::01100:2",
  786: 	 "::17000",
  787: 	 "::01700",
  788: 	 "10000::",
  789: 	 "01000::",
  790: 	 "::8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1",
  791: 	 "8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1::",
  792: 	 "8:7:6:5:4::3:2:1",
  793: 	 "::1.2.3.4.5",
  794: 	 "::1.2.3.04",
  795: 	 "::1.256.3.4",
  796: 	 "::-5.4.3.2",
  797: 	 "::5.-4.3.2",
  798: 	 "::5.4.-3.2",
  799: 	 "::5.4.3.-2",
  800: 	 "::FFFF:1.2.3.4.5",
  801: 	 "::10.",
  802: 	 "::FFFF:172.16.",
  803: 	 "fe80::198.168.0.",
  804: 	 "fec0::fFfF:127.0.0.1."],
  805:     t_parse_address
  806:       (parse_ipv6_address,
  807:        false,
  808:        V6Reversable++V6Sloppy++V6Err++V4Err),
  809:     t_parse_address
  810:       (parse_ipv6strict_address,
  811:        true,
  812:        V6Reversable++V6Err++V4Err),
  813:     t_parse_address
  814:       (parse_ipv4_address,
  815:        false,
  816:        V4Reversable++V4Sloppy++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V6Reversable]),
  817:     t_parse_address
  818:       (parse_ipv4strict_address,
  819:        true,
  820:        V4Reversable++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V4Sloppy++V6Reversable]).
  821: 
  822: t_parse_address(Func, _Reversable, []) ->
  823:     io:format("~p done.~n", [Func]),
  824:     ok;
  825: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [{Addr,String}|L]) ->
  826:     io:format("~p = ~p.~n", [Addr,String]),
  827:     {ok,Addr} = inet:Func(String),
  828:     case Reversible of
  829:         true ->String = inet:ntoa(Addr);
  830:         false -> ok
  831:     end,
  832:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L);
  833: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [String|L]) ->
  834:     io:format("~p.~n", [String]),
  835:     {error,einval} = inet:Func(String),
  836:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L).
  837: 
  838: parse_strict_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  839:     {ok, {127,0,0,1}} =
  840: 	inet:parse_strict_address("127.0.0.1"),
  841:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,21952,50796,119,136}} =
  842: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440:55c0:c66c:77:0088"),
  843:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,0,0,119,136}} =
  844: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440::077:0088").
  845: 
  846: is_ip_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  847:     IPv4Addresses = [
  848:         {0, 0, 0, 0},
  849:         {255, 255, 255, 255}
  850:     ],
  851:     IPv6Addresses = [
  852:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  853:         {16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff}
  854:     ],
  855:     NonIPAddresses = [
  856:         foo,
  857:         "0.0.0.0",
  858:         {},
  859:         {0},
  860:         {0, 0},
  861:         {0, 0, 0},
  862:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  863:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  864:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  865:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  866:         {0, 0, 0, foo},
  867:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, foo},
  868:         {0, 0, 0, 256},
  869:         {0, 0, 256, 0},
  870:         {0, 256, 0, 0},
  871:         {256, 0, 0, 0},
  872:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000},
  873:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0},
  874:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0},
  875:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0},
  876:         {0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  877:         {0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  878:         {0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  879:         {16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  880:         {0, 0, 0, -1},
  881:         {0, 0, -1, 0},
  882:         {0, -1, 0, 0},
  883:         {-1, 0, 0, 0},
  884:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1},
  885:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0},
  886:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0},
  887:         {0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0},
  888:         {0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  889:         {0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  890:         {0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  891:         {-1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}
  892:     ],
  893: 
  894:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv4Addresses),
  895:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
  896: 
  897:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv6Addresses),
  898:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv4Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
  899: 
  900:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ IPv4Addresses),
  901:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, NonIPAddresses).
  902: 
  903: ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  904:     {D1,D2,D3,D4} = IPv4Address =
  905:         {rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  906:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  907:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  908:          rand:uniform(256) - 1},
  909:     E7 = (D1 bsl 8) bor D2,
  910:     E8 = (D3 bsl 8) bor D4,
  911:     io:format("IPv4Address: ~p.~n", [IPv4Address]),
  912:     {0,0,0,0,0,65535,E7,E8} = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv4Address),
  913:     IPv6Address =
  914:         {rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  915:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  916:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  917:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  918:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
  919:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1, E7, E8},
  920:     IPv4Address = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv6Address),
  921:     ok.
  922: 
  923: 
  924: ntoa(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  925:     M8 = 1 bsl 8,
  926:     M16 = 1 bsl 16,
  927:     V4Xs = rand_tuple(4, M8),
  928:     V6Xs = rand_tuple(4, M16),
  929:     ntoa(
  930:       [{A, B, C, D} ||
  931:           A <- [0, element(1, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
  932:           B <- [0, element(2, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
  933:           C <- [0, element(3, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
  934:           D <- [0, element(4, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256]], M8-1),
  935:     ntoa(
  936:       [{E, F, G, H, G, G, E, F} ||
  937:           E <- [0, element(1, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
  938:           F <- [0, element(2, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
  939:           G <- [0, element(3, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
  940:           H <- [0, element(4, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16]], M16-1).
  941: 
  942: ntoa([A | As], Max) ->
  943:     case
  944:         lists:all(
  945:           fun (X) when 0 =< X, X =< Max -> true;
  946:               (_) -> false
  947:           end, tuple_to_list(A))
  948:     of
  949:         true ->
  950:             S = inet:ntoa(A),
  951:             {ok, A} = inet:parse_address(S);
  952:         false ->
  953:             {error, einval} = inet:ntoa(A)
  954:     end,
  955:     ntoa(As, Max);
  956: ntoa([], _Max) ->
  957:     ok.
  958: 
  959: rand_tuple(N, M) ->
  960:     rand_tuple(N, M, []).
  961: %%
  962: rand_tuple(0, _M, Acc) ->
  963:     list_to_tuple(Acc);
  964: rand_tuple(N, M, Acc) ->
  965:     rand_tuple(N - 1, M, [rand:uniform(M) - 1 | Acc]).
  966: 
  967: 
  968: t_gethostnative(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  969:     %% this will result in 26 bytes sent which causes problem in Windows
  970:     %% if the port-program has not assured stdin to be read in BINARY mode
  971:     %% OTP-2555
  972:     case inet_gethost_native:gethostbyname(
  973: 	   "a23456789012345678901234") of
  974: 	{error,notfound} ->
  975: 	    ok;
  976: 	{error,no_data} ->
  977: 	    ok;
  978: 	{error,try_again} ->
  979: 	    ok
  980:     end.
  981: 
  982: %% Check that the emulator survives crashes in gethost_native.
  983: gethostnative_parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  984:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
  985:     {ok,_} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
  986:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
  987: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  988: 	    do_gethostnative_parallell();
  989: 	_ ->
  990: 	    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
  991:     end.
  992: 
  993: do_gethostnative_parallell() ->
  994:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  995:     ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, parallell_gethost, []),
  996:     receive after 10000 -> ok end,
  997:     pong = net_adm:ping(Node),
  998:     peer:stop(Peer),
  999:     ok.
 1000: 
 1001: parallell_gethost() ->
 1002:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1003:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
 1004:     parallell_gethost_loop(10, Hostname).
 1005: 
 1006: parallell_gethost_loop(0, _) -> ok;
 1007: parallell_gethost_loop(N, Hostname) ->
 1008:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1009: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1010: 	    true = exit(Pid,kill);
 1011: 	_ ->
 1012: 	    ok
 1013:     end,
 1014: 
 1015:     L = spawn_gethosters(Hostname, 10),
 1016:     release_gethosters(L),
 1017:     collect_gethosters(10),
 1018:     parallell_gethost_loop(N-1, Hostname).
 1019: 
 1020: spawn_gethosters(_, 0) ->
 1021:     [];
 1022: spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N) ->
 1023:     Collector = self(),
 1024:     [spawn(fun() ->
 1025: 		   receive 
 1026: 		       go ->
 1027: 			   case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1028: 			       {ok,_} ->
 1029: 				   Collector ! ok;
 1030: 			       Else ->
 1031: 				   Collector ! {error,Else}
 1032: 			   end
 1033: 		   end 
 1034: 	   end) | 
 1035:      spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N-1)].
 1036: 
 1037: release_gethosters([]) ->
 1038:     ok;
 1039: release_gethosters([H|T]) ->
 1040:     H ! go,
 1041:     release_gethosters(T).
 1042: 
 1043: collect_gethosters(0) ->
 1044:     ok;
 1045: collect_gethosters(N) ->
 1046:     receive
 1047: 	ok ->
 1048: 	    collect_gethosters(N-1);
 1049: 	Else ->
 1050: 	    {failed, {unexpected, Else}}
 1051:     after 2000 ->
 1052: 	    {failed, {missing, N}}
 1053:     end.
 1054: 
 1055: kill_gethost() ->
 1056:     kill_gethost(20).
 1057: 
 1058: kill_gethost(0) ->
 1059:     ok;
 1060: kill_gethost(N) ->
 1061:     put(kill_gethost_n,N),
 1062:     Pid = wait_for_gethost(10),
 1063:     true = exit(Pid,kill),
 1064:     wait_for_dead_gethost(10),
 1065:     kill_gethost(N-1).
 1066: 
 1067: wait_for_dead_gethost(0) ->
 1068:     exit({not_dead,inet_gethost_native});
 1069: wait_for_dead_gethost(N) ->
 1070:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1071: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1072: 	    receive after 1000 ->
 1073: 			    ok
 1074: 		    end,
 1075: 	    wait_for_dead_gethost(N-1);
 1076: 	undefined ->
 1077: 	    ok
 1078:     end.
 1079: 
 1080: wait_for_gethost(0) ->
 1081:     exit(gethost_not_found);
 1082: wait_for_gethost(N) ->
 1083:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1084:     case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1085: 	{ok,_} ->
 1086: 	    ok;
 1087: 	Otherwise ->
 1088: 	    %% This is what I call an exit tuple :)
 1089: 	    exit({inet,gethostbyname, returned, Otherwise, 'when',
 1090: 		  'N','=',N,'and','hostname','=',Hostname,'and',
 1091: 		  kill_gethost_n,'=',get(kill_gethost_n)})
 1092:     end,
 1093:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1094: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1095: 	    Pid;
 1096: 	_ ->
 1097: 	    receive
 1098: 	    after 1000 ->
 1099: 		    ok
 1100: 	    end,
 1101: 	    wait_for_gethost(N-1)
 1102:     end.
 1103: 
 1104: %% Check that the resolver handles a CNAME loop.
 1105: cname_loop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1106:     %% getbyname (hostent_by_domain)
 1107:     ok = inet_db:add_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, ttl, "mydomain.com"),
 1108:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:getbyname("mydomain.com", ?S_A),
 1109:     ok = inet_db:del_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, "mydomain.com"),
 1110:     %% res_hostent_by_domain
 1111:     RR = #dns_rr{domain = "mydomain.com",
 1112: 		 class = in,
 1113: 		 type = ?S_CNAME,
 1114: 		 data = "mydomain.com"},
 1115:     Rec = #dns_rec{anlist = [RR]},
 1116:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:res_hostent_by_domain("mydomain.com", ?S_A, Rec),
 1117:     ok.
 1118: 
 1119: 
 1120: %% Test that hosts file gets reloaded correctly in case when it
 1121: % was missing during initial startup
 1122: missing_hosts_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1123:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1124:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ ".hosts"),
 1125:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "inetrc"),
 1126:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1127:     {error, enoent} = file:read_file_info(HostsFile),
 1128:     % start a node
 1129:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1130:     % ensure it has our RC
 1131:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1132:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1133:     % ensure it does not resolve
 1134:     {error, nxdomain} = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1135:     % write hosts file
 1136:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, "1.2.3.4 somehost"),
 1137:     % wait for cached timestamp to expire
 1138:     timer:sleep(?RES_FILE_UPDATE_TM * 1000 + 100),
 1139:     % ensure it DOES resolve
 1140:     {ok,{hostent,"somehost",[],inet,4,[{1,2,3,4}]}} =
 1141:         rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1142:     % cleanup
 1143:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1144: 
 1145: 
 1146: %% The /etc/hosts file format and limitations is quite undocumented.
 1147: %%
 1148: %% Our implementation of the hosts file resolver tries to
 1149: %% do the right thing.  Here is an attempt to define "the right thing",
 1150: %% and this test case tries to check most of these rules:
 1151: %%
 1152: %% * A hosts file consists of entries with one IP address,
 1153: %%   and a list of host names.  The IP address is IPv4 or IPv6.
 1154: %%   The first host name is the primary host name
 1155: %%   and the others are aliases.
 1156: %%
 1157: %% * A lookup for an IP address should return one #hostent{} record
 1158: %%   with the one IP address from the query, and the host names
 1159: %%   from all entries with the same IP address concatenated.
 1160: %%   The first host name from the first hosts file entry
 1161: %%   with the requested IP address will be the primary host name
 1162: %%   and all others are aliases.  All host names are returned
 1163: %%   as in the hosts file entries i.e character case is preserved.
 1164: %%
 1165: %% * A lookup for a host name is character case insensitive.
 1166: %%
 1167: %% * A lookup for a host name should return one #hostent{} record
 1168: %%   with the host name list from the first hosts file entry
 1169: %%   with an IP address of the requested address family
 1170: %%   that has a matching host name, as it is in the hosts file
 1171: %%   i.e character case is preserved.  The IP addresses in the
 1172: %%   returned #hostent{} record should be the first from the
 1173: %%   same matching hosts file entry, followed by all others
 1174: %%   for which there is a matching host name and address family.
 1175: %%   There should be no duplicates among the returned IP addresses.
 1176: %%
 1177: %% * These rules are of the opinion that if duplicate host names
 1178: %%   with the same character casing occurs for the same IP
 1179: %%   address, it is a configuration error, so it is not tested for
 1180: %%   and there is no preferred behaviour.
 1181: hosts_file_quirks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1182:     Records = [R1, R2, R3, R4, R5] =
 1183:         [#hostent{
 1184:             h_name = h_ex(Name),
 1185:             h_aliases = [h_ex(Alias) || Alias <- Aliases],
 1186:             h_addrtype = Fam,
 1187:             h_length =
 1188:                 case Fam of
 1189:                     inet -> 4;
 1190:                     inet6 -> 16
 1191:                 end,
 1192:             h_addr_list =
 1193:                 [case Fam of
 1194:                      inet -> inet_ex(N);
 1195:                      inet6 -> inet6_ex(N)
 1196:                  end]}
 1197:          || {{Fam,N}, Name, Aliases} <-
 1198:                 [{{inet,1}, "a", ["B"]},
 1199:                  {{inet,2}, "D", []},
 1200:                  {{inet6,3}, "A", ["c"]},
 1201:                  {{inet,1}, "c", []},
 1202:                  {{inet,5}, "A", []}]],
 1203:     true = R1#hostent.h_addr_list =:= R4#hostent.h_addr_list,
 1204:     R14 =
 1205:         R1#hostent{
 1206:           h_aliases =
 1207:               R1#hostent.h_aliases ++
 1208:               [R4#hostent.h_name | R4#hostent.h_aliases]},
 1209:     R145 =
 1210:         R14#hostent{
 1211:           h_addr_list =
 1212:               R1#hostent.h_addr_list ++ R5#hostent.h_addr_list},
 1213:     %%
 1214:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1215:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-quirks.hosts"),
 1216:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "quirks.inetrc"),
 1217:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, hostents_to_list(Records)),
 1218:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1219:     %%
 1220:     %% start a node
 1221:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1222:     %% ensure it has our RC
 1223:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1224:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1225:     false = lists:keyfind(host, 1, Rc),
 1226:     %%
 1227:     %% check entries
 1228:     io:format("Check hosts file contents~n", []),
 1229:     V1 =
 1230:       [{R14, inet_ex(1)},
 1231:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1232:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1233:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1234:        {R145, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1235:        {R14, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1236:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1237:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1238:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1239:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1240:       ],
 1241:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1242:     %%
 1243:     %% test add and del
 1244:     A1 = inet_ex(1),
 1245:     Hs1 = [h_ex("a"), h_ex("B")],
 1246:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, add_host, [A1, Hs1]),
 1247:     io:format("Check after add host~n", []),
 1248:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(
 1249:       TestNode,
 1250:       [{R1, A1},
 1251:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1252:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1253:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1254:        {R1, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1255:        {R1, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1256:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1257:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1258:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1259:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1260:       ]),
 1261:     {host, A1, Hs1} =
 1262:         lists:keyfind(host, 1, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, [])),
 1263:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, del_host, [inet_ex(1)]),
 1264:     io:format("Check after del host~n", []),
 1265:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1266:     %%
 1267:     %% cleanup
 1268:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1269: 
 1270: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs) ->
 1271:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs, true).
 1272: %%
 1273: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, [], Ok) ->
 1274:     case Ok of
 1275:         true -> ok;
 1276:         false -> error(verify_failed)
 1277:     end;
 1278: hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, [V | Vs], Ok) ->
 1279:     case
 1280:         case V of
 1281:             {R, Addr} ->
 1282:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyaddr, [Addr])};
 1283:             {R, Host, Fam} ->
 1284:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, [Host, Fam])}
 1285:         end
 1286:     of
 1287:         {nxdomain, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1288:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1289:         {_R_1, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1290:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: nxdomain~n", [V]),
 1291:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false);
 1292:         {R_1, {ok, R_1}} ->
 1293:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1294:         {_R_1, {ok, R_2}} ->
 1295:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: ~p~n", [V, R_2]),
 1296:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false)
 1297:     end.
 1298: 
 1299: %% Expand entry
 1300: h_ex(H) -> H ++ ".example.com".
 1301: inet_ex(N) -> {127,17,17,N}.
 1302: inet6_ex(N) -> {0,0,0,0,17,17,17,N}.
 1303: 
 1304: hostents_to_list([]) -> [];
 1305: hostents_to_list([R | Rs]) ->
 1306:     #hostent{
 1307:        h_name = Name,
 1308:        h_aliases = Aliases,
 1309:        h_addr_list = [IP]} = R,
 1310:     [inet:ntoa(IP), $\t,
 1311:      lists:join($\s, [Name | Aliases]), $\r, $\n
 1312:      | hostents_to_list(Rs)].
 1313: 
 1314: 
 1315: %% These must be run in the whole suite since they need
 1316: %% the host list and require inet_gethost_native to be started.
 1317: %%
 1318: -record(gethostnative_control, {control_seq,
 1319: 				control_interval = 100,
 1320: 				lookup_delay     = 10,
 1321: 				lookup_count     = 300,
 1322: 				lookup_processes = 20}).
 1323: 
 1324: gethostnative_soft_restart() -> required(hosts).
 1325: 
 1326: %% Check that no name lookups fails during soft restart
 1327: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1328: gethostnative_soft_restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1329:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1330:                                         [soft_restart]),
 1331:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1332: 
 1333: gethostnative_debug_level() -> required(hosts).
 1334: 
 1335: %% Check that no name lookups fails during debug level change
 1336: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1337: gethostnative_debug_level(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1338:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1339:                                         [{debug_level, 1},
 1340:                                          {debug_level, 0}]),
 1341:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1342: 
 1343: gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config, CtrlSeq) ->
 1344:     Factor = ?config(kernel_factor, Config),
 1345:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(Factor, CtrlSeq).
 1346: 
 1347: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(1, CtrlSeq) ->
 1348:     #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq};
 1349: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(F, CtrlSeq) ->
 1350:     Opts = #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq},
 1351:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(F, Opts).
 1352: 
 1353: gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(
 1354:   F,
 1355:   #gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1356:                          lookup_processes = NProc} = Opts) ->
 1357:     Adjust = fun(X) ->
 1358:                      if
 1359:                          F > 10 ->
 1360:                              X div 4;
 1361:                          F > 5 ->
 1362:                              X div 3;
 1363:                          F > 2 -> 
 1364:                              (2 * X) div 3;
 1365:                          true ->
 1366:                              X
 1367:                      end
 1368:              end,
 1369:     Opts#gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Adjust(Cnt),
 1370:                                lookup_processes = Adjust(NProc)}.
 1371: 
 1372: 
 1373: gethostnative_control(Config, Opts) ->
 1374:     case inet_db:res_option(lookup) of
 1375: 	[native] ->
 1376: 	    case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1377: 		Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1378: 		    gethostnative_control_1(Config, Opts);
 1379: 		_ ->
 1380: 		    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
 1381: 	    end;
 1382: 	_ ->
 1383: 	    {skipped, "Native not only lookup method"}
 1384:     end.
 1385: 
 1386: gethostnative_control_1(
 1387:   Config,
 1388:   #gethostnative_control{control_seq      = Seq,
 1389:                          control_interval = Interval,
 1390:                          lookup_delay     = Delay,
 1391:                          lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1392:                          lookup_processes = N}) ->
 1393:     ?P("gethostnative control -> begin with"
 1394:        "~n      Ctrl Seq:      ~p"
 1395:        "~n      Ctrl interval: ~p"
 1396:        "~n      Lookup delay:  ~p"
 1397:        "~n      Lookup count:  ~p"
 1398:        "~n      Lookup procs:  ~p", [Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N]),
 1399:     {ok, Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1400:     {ok, _}        = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
 1401:     Hosts          =
 1402:         [Hostname|[H || {_,H} <- get_hosts(Config)]
 1403:          ++[H++D || H <- ["www.","www1.","www2.",""],
 1404:         	    D <- ["erlang.org","erlang.se"]]
 1405:          ++[H++"cslab.ericsson.net" || H <- ["morgoth.","hades.","styx."]]],
 1406:     ?P("ctrl-1: Hosts: "
 1407:        "~n   ~p", [Hosts]),
 1408:     %% Spawn some processes to do parallel lookups while
 1409:     %% I repeatedly do inet_gethost_native:control/1.
 1410:     TrapExit = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1411:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1412:     erlang:display(first_intermission),
 1413:     ?P("ctrl-1: First intermission: "
 1414:        "~n   Now starting control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1415:     gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1416:     erlang:display(second_intermission),
 1417:     ?P("ctrl-1: Second intermission: "
 1418:        "~n   Now stopping control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1419:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1420:     true = process_flag(trap_exit, TrapExit),
 1421:     ?P("control-1: done"),
 1422:     ok.
 1423: 
 1424: gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts) ->
 1425:     Tag       = make_ref(),
 1426:     Parent    = self(),
 1427:     Lookup    = fun() ->
 1428:                         ?P("lookuper starting"),
 1429:                         lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) 
 1430:                 end,
 1431:     Lookupers = [spawn_link(Lookup) || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1432:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq),
 1433:     gethostnative_control_3(Tag, ok).
 1434: 
 1435: gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Reason) ->
 1436:     receive
 1437: 	{Tag, Lookuper, Error} ->
 1438:             ?P("control-3: received lookup error from ~p: ~p",
 1439:                [Lookuper, Error]),
 1440: 	    gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Error)
 1441:     after 0 ->
 1442:             ?P("control-3: no (more) lookup errors"),
 1443: 	    Reason
 1444:     end.
 1445: 
 1446: control_loop([], _Interval, _Tag, [], _Seq) ->
 1447:     ok;
 1448: control_loop([], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1449:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq);
 1450: control_loop([Op|Ops], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1451:     control_loop(Ops, Interval, Tag, 
 1452: 		 control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers),
 1453: 		 Seq).
 1454: 
 1455: control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers) ->
 1456:     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: await lookuper exit"),
 1457:     receive
 1458:         {'EXIT', _Pid, {timetrap_timeout, _, _}} ->
 1459:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1460:                "timetrap timeout while ~w lookupers remaining: "
 1461:                "~n   Op:       ~p"
 1462:                "~n   Interval: ~p"
 1463:                "~n   Tag:      ~p",
 1464:                [length(Lookupers), Op, Interval, Tag]),
 1465:             if
 1466:                 (Op =/= undefined) ->
 1467:                     exit({timetrap, {Op, Tag, length(Lookupers)}});
 1468:                 true ->
 1469:                     exit({timetrap, {Tag, length(Lookupers)}})
 1470:             end;
 1471: 
 1472: 	{'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
 1473: 	    case Reason of
 1474: 		Tag -> % Done
 1475:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1476:                        "received expected exit from lookuper ~p", [Pid]),
 1477: 		    control_loop_1
 1478: 		      (Op, Interval, Tag,
 1479: 		       lists:delete(Pid, Lookupers));
 1480: 		_ ->
 1481:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1482:                        "received unexpected exit from ~p: "
 1483:                        "~n   ~p", [Pid, Reason]),
 1484: 		    ct:fail(?F("Unexpected exit from ~p", [Pid]))
 1485: 	    end
 1486: 
 1487:     after Interval ->
 1488:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1489:                "timeout => (maybe) attempt control ~p when"
 1490:                "~n   Lookupers: ~p", [Op, Lookupers]),
 1491: 	    if Op =/= undefined ->
 1492: 		    ok = inet_gethost_native:control(Op);
 1493: 	       true ->
 1494: 		    ok
 1495: 	    end,
 1496: 	    Lookupers
 1497:     end.
 1498: 
 1499: lookup_loop(_, _Delay, Tag, _Parent,  0, _Hosts) ->
 1500:     ?P("lookup-loop: done with ~p", [Tag]),
 1501:     exit(Tag);
 1502: lookup_loop([], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1503:     ?P("lookup-loop: begin lookup (~p) again when count = ~p", [Tag, Cnt]),
 1504:     lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts);
 1505: lookup_loop([H|Hs], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1506:     ?P("lookup-loop: try lookup (~p, ~p) ~p", [Tag, Cnt, H]),
 1507:     case inet:gethostbyname(H) of
 1508: 	{ok, _Hent} ->
 1509:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => found"),
 1510:             ok;
 1511: 	{error, nxdomain} ->
 1512:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => nxdomain"),
 1513:             ok;
 1514: 	Error ->
 1515: 	    ?P("loopkup-loop: lookup => error for ~p: ~p", [H, Error]),
 1516: 	    Parent ! {Tag, self(), Error}
 1517:     end,
 1518:     receive
 1519:     after rand:uniform(Delay) ->
 1520: 	    lookup_loop(Hs, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt-1, Hosts) 
 1521:     end.
 1522: 
 1523: 
 1524: 
 1525: %% Test lookup with erroneously configured lookup option (OTP-12133).
 1526: lookup_bad_search_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1527:     %% Manipulation of resolver config is done in init_per_testcase
 1528:     %% and end_per_testcase to ensure cleanup.
 1529:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1530:     {ok,_Hent} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname), % Will hang loop for this bug
 1531:     ok.
 1532: 
 1533: 
 1534: 
 1535: %% Tests basic functionality of getiflist, getif, and ifget.
 1536: getif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1537:     case os:type() of
 1538: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1539: 	    do_getif(Osname, default),
 1540:             do_getif(Osname, inet),
 1541:             do_getif(Osname, socket);
 1542: 	{_,_} ->
 1543: 	    {skip,"inet:getif/0 probably not supported"}
 1544:     end.
 1545: 
 1546: inet_getiflist(default) ->
 1547:     inet:getiflist();
 1548: inet_getiflist(Backend) ->
 1549:     Func = getiflist,
 1550:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1551:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1552: 
 1553: 
 1554: backend_conditional_run(default = Backend, Func, Fun)
 1555:   when is_atom(Func) andalso
 1556:        is_function(Fun, 0) ->
 1557:        io:format("try '~w' ~w~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1558:        Fun();
 1559: backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun)
 1560:   when ((Backend =:= inet) orelse (Backend =:= socket)) andalso
 1561:        is_atom(Func) andalso
 1562:        is_function(Fun, 0) ->
 1563:     try is_supported_backend(Backend) of
 1564:         true ->
 1565:             io:format("try '~w' ~w~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1566:             Fun();            
 1567:         false ->
 1568:             io:format("skip '~w' ~w: not supported~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1569:             throw({skip, {Func, Backend, notsup}})
 1570:     catch
 1571:         C:E:S ->
 1572:             %% Assume its because we run in a 'noesock' (or similar) system...
 1573:             io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1574:                       "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1575:                       "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1576:                       "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1577:                       "~n", [Backend, C, E, S]),
 1578:             throw({skip, {Func, Backend, C, E}})
 1579:     end.            
 1580: 
 1581: 
 1582: inet_ifget(default, Name, Opts) ->
 1583:     inet:ifget(Name, Opts);
 1584: inet_ifget(Backend, Name, Opts) ->
 1585:     Func = ifget,
 1586:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func(Name, [{inet_backend, Backend}|Opts]) end,
 1587:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1588: 
 1589: inet_getif(default) ->
 1590:     inet:getif();
 1591: inet_getif(Backend) ->
 1592:     Func = getif,
 1593:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1594:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1595:     
 1596: 
 1597: do_getif(OsName, Backend) ->
 1598:     io:format("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1599:               "~n   OsName:  ~p"
 1600:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, OsName]),
 1601:     try do_getif2(OsName, Backend) of
 1602:         ok ->
 1603:             io:format("~w(~w) -> success~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1604:             ok
 1605:     catch
 1606:         throw:{skip, Reason} ->
 1607:             io:format("~w(~w) -> skipping: "
 1608:                       "~n   ~p"
 1609:                       "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Reason]),
 1610:             ok
 1611:     end.
 1612: 
 1613: do_getif2(OsName, Backend) ->
 1614:     io:format("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1615:               "~n   OsName:  ~p"
 1616:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, OsName]),
 1617: 
 1618:     %% For this to work with the 'socket' backend, we need to verify 
 1619:     {ok, Hostname}   = inet:gethostname(),
 1620:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1621:               "~n   Hostname: ~p"
 1622:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Hostname]),
 1623:     {ok, Address}    = inet:getaddr(Hostname,    inet),
 1624:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1625:               "~n   Address: ~p"
 1626:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Address]),
 1627:     {ok, Loopback}   = inet:getaddr("localhost", inet),
 1628:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1629:               "~n   Loopback: ~p"
 1630:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Loopback]),
 1631:     {ok, Interfaces} = inet_getiflist(Backend),
 1632:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1633:               "~n   Interfaces: ~p"
 1634:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Interfaces]),
 1635:     HWAs =
 1636:         lists:sort(
 1637:           lists:foldl(
 1638:             fun (I, Acc) ->
 1639:                     case inet_ifget(Backend, I, [hwaddr]) of
 1640:                         {ok,[{hwaddr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1641:                         {ok,[]} -> Acc
 1642:                     end
 1643:             end, [], Interfaces)),
 1644:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1645:               "~n   HW Addrs:"
 1646:               "~n      ~p"
 1647:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, HWAs]),
 1648:     (OsName =/= sunos)
 1649:         andalso ((length(HWAs) > 0) orelse (ct:fail(no_HWAs))),
 1650:     Addresses =
 1651:         lists:sort(
 1652:           lists:foldl(
 1653:             fun(I, Acc) ->
 1654:                     case inet_ifget(Backend, I, [addr]) of
 1655:                         {ok, [{addr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1656:                         {ok, []} -> Acc
 1657:                     end
 1658:             end, [], Interfaces)),
 1659:     io:format("~w(~w) -> ifget result: "
 1660:               "~n   Addresses: "
 1661:               "~n      ~p"
 1662:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Addresses]),
 1663:     {ok, Getif} = inet_getif(Backend),
 1664:     io:format("~w(~w) -> ifget verify: "
 1665:               "~n   Addresses: "
 1666:               "~n      ~p"
 1667:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Addresses]),
 1668:     Addresses = lists:sort([A || {A,_,_} <- Getif]),
 1669:     io:format("~w(~w) -> verify address"
 1670:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1671:     true = ip_member(Address, Addresses),
 1672:     io:format("~w(~w) -> verify loopback"
 1673:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1674:     true = ip_member(Loopback, Addresses),
 1675:     io:format("~w(~w) -> done~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1676:     ok.
 1677: 
 1678: %% Test long interface names do not overrun buffer.
 1679: getif_ifr_name_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1680:     case os:type() of
 1681: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1682: 	    do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(Osname);
 1683: 	{_,_} ->
 1684: 	    {skip,"inet:ifget/2 probably not supported"}
 1685:     end.
 1686: 
 1687: do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(_) ->
 1688:     %% emulator should not crash
 1689:     {ok,[]} = inet:ifget(lists:duplicate(128, "x"), [addr]),
 1690:     ok.
 1691: 
 1692: %% Test long service names do not overrun buffer.
 1693: getservbyname_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1694:     %% emulator should not crash
 1695:     {error,einval} = inet:getservbyname(list_to_atom(lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(128, "x"))), tcp),
 1696:     ok.
 1697: 
 1698: 
 1699: %% Test inet:gifaddrs/0.
 1700: getifaddrs(Config) when is_list (Config) ->
 1701:     do_getifaddrs(default),
 1702:     do_getifaddrs(inet),
 1703:     do_getifaddrs(socket),
 1704:     getifaddrs_verify_backends().
 1705: 
 1706: do_getifaddrs(Backend) ->
 1707:     try do_getifaddrs2(Backend) of
 1708:         ok ->
 1709:             io:format("~w(~w) -> success~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1710:             ok
 1711:     catch
 1712:         throw:{skip, Reason} ->
 1713:             io:format("~w(~w) -> skipping: "
 1714:                       "~n   ~p"
 1715:                       "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Reason]),
 1716:             ok
 1717:     end.
 1718: 
 1719: 
 1720: do_getifaddrs2(default) ->
 1721:     io:format("try 'default' getifaddrs~n", []),
 1722:     do_getifaddrs3(inet:getifaddrs());
 1723: do_getifaddrs2(Backend) ->
 1724:     Func = getifaddrs,
 1725:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1726:     do_getifaddrs3(backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun)).
 1727:     
 1728: 
 1729: is_supported_backend(inet = _Backend) ->
 1730:     true;
 1731: is_supported_backend(socket = _Backend) ->
 1732:     is_socket_supported().
 1733: 
 1734: is_socket_supported() ->
 1735:     try socket:info() of
 1736:         #{} ->
 1737:             true
 1738:     catch
 1739:         error : notsup ->
 1740:             false;
 1741:         error : undef ->
 1742:             false
 1743:     end.
 1744: 
 1745:     
 1746: do_getifaddrs3({ok, IfAddrs}) ->
 1747:     io:format("~w(ok) -> IfAddrs: "
 1748:               "~n   ~p"
 1749:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, IfAddrs]),
 1750:     case [If || {If,Opts} <- IfAddrs, lists:keymember(hwaddr, 1, Opts)] of
 1751:         [] ->
 1752:             case os:type() of
 1753:                 {unix,sunos} -> ok;
 1754:                 OT ->
 1755:                     ct:fail({should_have_hwaddr,OT})
 1756:             end;
 1757:         [_|_] -> ok
 1758:     end,
 1759:     Addrs = ifaddrs(IfAddrs),
 1760:     io:format("Addrs: "
 1761:               "~n   ~p"
 1762:               "~n", [Addrs]),
 1763:     [check_addr(Addr) || Addr <- Addrs],
 1764:     ok.
 1765: 
 1766: check_addr(Addr)
 1767:   when tuple_size(Addr) =:= 8,
 1768:        element(1, Addr) band 16#FFC0 =:= 16#FE80 ->
 1769:     io:format("Addr: ~p link local; SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1770:     ok;
 1771: check_addr({169, 254, 118, _} = Addr) ->
 1772:     io:format("Addr: ~p reserved (not usable); SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1773:     ok;
 1774: check_addr(Addr) ->
 1775:     io:format("Addr: ~p.~n", [Addr]),
 1776:     Ping = "ping",
 1777:     Pong = "pong",
 1778:     {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ip,Addr},{active,false}]),
 1779:     {ok,P} = inet:port(L),
 1780:     {ok,S1} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, P, [{active,false}]),
 1781:     {ok,S2} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1782:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S2, Ping),
 1783:     {ok,Ping} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, length(Ping)),
 1784:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S1, Pong),
 1785:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S1),
 1786:     {ok,Pong} = gen_tcp:recv(S2, length(Pong)),
 1787:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S2),
 1788:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1789: 
 1790: ifaddrs(IfOpts) ->
 1791:     IfMap = collect_ifopts(IfOpts),
 1792:     ChkFun =
 1793:         fun Self({{_,Flags} = Key, Opts}, ok) ->
 1794:                 Broadcast = lists:member(broadcast, Flags),
 1795:                 P2P = lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags),
 1796:                 case Opts of
 1797:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{broadaddr,_}|Os]
 1798:                       when Broadcast ->
 1799:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1800:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{dstaddr,_}|Os]
 1801:                       when P2P ->
 1802:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1803:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_}|Os] ->
 1804:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1805:                     [{hwaddr,_}|Os] ->
 1806:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1807:                     [] ->
 1808:                         ok
 1809:                 end
 1810:         end,
 1811:     fold_ifopts(ChkFun, ok, IfMap),
 1812:     AddrsFun =
 1813:         fun ({{_,Flags}, Opts}, Acc) ->
 1814:                 case
 1815:                     lists:member(running, Flags)
 1816:                     andalso (not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags))
 1817:                 of
 1818:                     true ->
 1819:                         lists:reverse(
 1820:                           [Addr || {addr,Addr} <- Opts],
 1821:                           Acc);
 1822:                     false ->
 1823:                         Acc
 1824:                 end
 1825:         end,
 1826:     fold_ifopts(AddrsFun, [], IfMap).
 1827: 
 1828: collect_ifopts(IfOpts) ->
 1829:     collect_ifopts(IfOpts, #{}).
 1830: %%
 1831: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap) ->
 1832:     case IfOpts of
 1833:         [{If,[{flags,Flags}|Opts]}|IfOs] ->
 1834:             Key = {If,Flags},
 1835:             case maps:is_key(Key, IfMap) of
 1836:                 true ->
 1837:                     ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap});
 1838:                 false ->
 1839:                     collect_ifopts(IfOs, IfMap, Opts, Key, [])
 1840:             end;
 1841:         [] ->
 1842:             IfMap;
 1843:         _ ->
 1844:             ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap})
 1845:     end.
 1846: %%
 1847: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Opts, Key, R) ->
 1848:     case Opts of
 1849:         [{flags,_}|_] ->
 1850:             {If,_} = Key,
 1851:             collect_ifopts(
 1852:               [{If,Opts}|IfOpts], maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap));
 1853:         [OptVal|Os] ->
 1854:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Os, Key, [OptVal|R]);
 1855:         [] ->
 1856:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap))
 1857:     end.
 1858: 
 1859: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap) ->
 1860:     fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, maps:keys(IfMap)).
 1861: %%
 1862: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, Keys) ->
 1863:     case Keys of
 1864:         [Key|Ks] ->
 1865:             Opts = maps:get(Key, IfMap),
 1866:             fold_ifopts(Fun, Fun({Key,Opts}, Acc), IfMap, Ks);
 1867:         [] ->
 1868:             Acc
 1869:     end.
 1870: 
 1871: 
 1872: getifaddrs_verify_backends() ->
 1873:     io:format("maybe attempt verify backends~n", []),
 1874:     try is_supported_backend(inet) of
 1875:         true ->
 1876:             try is_supported_backend(socket) of
 1877:                 true ->
 1878:                     getifaddrs_verify_backends(
 1879:                       inet:getifaddrs([{inet_backend, inet}]),
 1880:                       inet:getifaddrs([{inet_backend, socket}]));
 1881:                 false ->
 1882:                     io:format("'socket' backend not supported: skip~n", [])
 1883:             catch
 1884:                 SC:SE:SS ->
 1885:                     io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1886:                               "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1887:                               "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1888:                               "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1889:                               "~n", [socket, SC, SE, SS]),
 1890:                     ok
 1891:             end;
 1892:         false ->
 1893:             io:format("'inet' backend not supported: skip~n", [])
 1894:     catch
 1895:         IC:IE:IS ->
 1896:             io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1897:                       "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1898:                       "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1899:                       "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1900:                       "~n", [inet, IC, IE, IS]),
 1901:             ok
 1902:     end.
 1903: 
 1904: getifaddrs_verify_backends({ok, IfAddrs},
 1905:                            {ok, IfAddrs}) ->
 1906:     io:format("IfAddrs are equal: "
 1907:               "~n   ~p"
 1908:               "~n", [IfAddrs]),
 1909:     ok;
 1910: getifaddrs_verify_backends({ok, IfAddrs_INET},
 1911:                            {ok, IfAddrs_SOCKET}) ->
 1912:     io:format("IfAddrs are not *identical* - check what differs: "
 1913:               "~n   INET:"
 1914:               "~n      ~p"
 1915:               "~n   SOCKET:"
 1916:               "~n      ~p"
 1917:               "~n   INET -- SOCKET: "
 1918:               "~n      ~p"
 1919:               "~n   SOCKET -- INET: "
 1920:               "~n      ~p"
 1921:               "~n", [IfAddrs_INET, IfAddrs_SOCKET,
 1922:                      IfAddrs_INET -- IfAddrs_SOCKET,
 1923:                      IfAddrs_SOCKET -- IfAddrs_INET]),
 1924:     getifaddrs_verify_backends2(IfAddrs_INET, IfAddrs_SOCKET).
 1925: 
 1926: getifaddrs_verify_backends2(INET, SOCKET) ->
 1927:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(lists:keysort(1, INET),
 1928:                                 lists:keysort(1, SOCKET)).
 1929: 
 1930: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([] = _INET, [] = _SOCKET) ->
 1931:     ok;
 1932: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([] = _INET, SOCKET) ->
 1933:     io:format("'socket' backend contains extra interfaces: "
 1934:               "~n   ~p"
 1935:               "~n", [SOCKET]),
 1936:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 1937: getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, [] = _SOCKET) ->
 1938:     io:format("'inet' backend contains extra interfaces: "
 1939:               "~n   ~p"
 1940:               "~n", [INET]),
 1941:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 1942: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{IF, INFO}|INET],
 1943:                             [{IF, INFO}|SOCKET]) ->
 1944:     io:format("backend(s) identical for ~p~n", [IF]),
 1945:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, SOCKET);
 1946: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{IF, I_INFO}|INET],
 1947:                             [{IF, S_INFO}|SOCKET]) ->
 1948:     io:format("backend(s) not *identical* for ~p~n", [IF]),
 1949:     getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_INFO, S_INFO),
 1950:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, SOCKET);
 1951: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{I_IF, _}|_], [{S_IF, _}|_]) ->
 1952:     io:format("not equal interfaces"
 1953:               "~n   ~p"
 1954:               "~n   ~p"
 1955:               "~n", [I_IF, S_IF]),
 1956:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal).
 1957: 
 1958: 
 1959: %% On windows the info may be in different order
 1960: %% (inet and net versions) because the information
 1961: %% comes from several sources. And the processing
 1962: %% is different on inet and net.
 1963: %% The info always starts with 'flags' and ends with
 1964: %% 'hwaddr'. So deal with those two first and the rest
 1965: %% can compared after.
 1966: 
 1967: getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_INFO, S_INFO) ->
 1968:     {I_Rest1, S_Rest1} =
 1969:         case {I_INFO, S_INFO} of
 1970:             {[{flags, I_FLAGS}|IR1], [{flags, S_FLAGS}|SR1]} ->
 1971:                 case {I_FLAGS -- S_FLAGS, S_FLAGS -- I_FLAGS} of
 1972:                     {[], []} ->
 1973:                         io:format("flags for ~p *are* equal~n", [IF]),
 1974:                         {IR1, SR1};
 1975:                     {[], [multicast]} ->
 1976:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - "
 1977:                                   "extra flag 'multicast': "
 1978:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 1979:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 1980:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS]),
 1981:                         case lists:member(loopback, I_FLAGS) of
 1982:                             true ->
 1983:                                 %% The net module getifaddrs contains
 1984:                                 %% some more flags...
 1985:                                 %% Happens on windows
 1986:                                 io:format("flags for ~p *acceptably* "
 1987:                                           "different~n", [IF]),
 1988:                                 {IR1, SR1};
 1989:                             _ ->
 1990:                                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 1991:                         end;
 1992:                     {[], [running]} ->
 1993:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - "
 1994:                                   "extra flag 'running': "
 1995:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 1996:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 1997:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS]),
 1998:                         case lists:member(up, I_FLAGS) of
 1999:                             true ->
 2000:                                 %% The net module getifaddrs contains
 2001:                                 %% some more flags...
 2002:                                 %% Happens on windows
 2003:                                 io:format("flags for ~p *acceptably* "
 2004:                                           "different~n", [IF]),
 2005:                                 {IR1, SR1};
 2006:                             _ ->
 2007:                                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2008:                         end;
 2009:                     {IRem, SRem} ->
 2010:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - check flags: "
 2011:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2012:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2013:                                   "~n   INET -- SOCKET: ~p"
 2014:                                   "~n   SOCKET -- INET: ~p"
 2015:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS, IRem, SRem]),
 2016:                         ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2017:                 end;
 2018:             _ ->
 2019:                 io:format("flags for ~p missing for one or both backends: "
 2020:                           "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2021:                           "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2022:                           "~n", [IF, I_INFO, S_INFO]),
 2023:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2024:         end,
 2025:     {I_Rest2, S_Rest2} =
 2026:         case {lists:reverse(I_Rest1), lists:reverse(S_Rest1)} of
 2027:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}|IR2], [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2028:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *is* equal~n", [IF]),
 2029:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2030:             {[{hwaddr, I_HWADDR}|_IR2], [{hwaddr, S_HWADDR}|_SR2]} ->
 2031:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *not* equal:"
 2032:                           "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2033:                           "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2034:                           "~n", [IF, I_HWADDR, S_HWADDR]),
 2035:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2036:             {IR2, [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2037:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p only for socket - accept: "
 2038:                           "~n   ~p"
 2039:                           "~n", [IF, HWADDR]),
 2040:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2041:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}|_IR2], _SR2} ->
 2042:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p only for inet - fail: "
 2043:                           "~n   ~p"
 2044:                           "~n", [IF, HWADDR]),
 2045:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2046:             _ ->
 2047:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p missing for both backends - accept~n",
 2048:                           [IF]),
 2049:                 {I_Rest1, S_Rest1}
 2050:         end,
 2051:     case {I_Rest2 -- S_Rest2, S_Rest2 -- I_Rest2} of
 2052:         {[], []} ->
 2053:             io:format("remaining info for ~p is equal~n", [IF]),
 2054:             ok;
 2055:         {I_Diff, S_Diff} ->
 2056:             io:format("remaining info for ~p not equal: "
 2057:                       "~n   INET:           ~p"
 2058:                       "~n   SOCKET:         ~p"
 2059:                       "~n   INET -- SOCKET: ~p"
 2060:                       "~n   SOCKET -- INET: ~p"
 2061:                       "~n", [IF, I_Rest2, S_Rest2, I_Diff, S_Diff]),
 2062:             %% Check if its a link local address, then ignore...
 2063:             %% This is "a bit" loosey-goosey...
 2064:             case lists:keysearch(addr, 1, S_Rest2) of
 2065:                 {value, {addr, {169, 254, _, _}}} ->
 2066:                     io:format("link local address for ~p - accept~n", [IF]),
 2067:                     ok;
 2068:                 _ ->
 2069:                     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2070:             end
 2071:     end.
 2072: 
 2073: 
 2074: %% Works just like lists:member/2, except that any {127,_,_,_} tuple
 2075: %% matches any other {127,_,_,_}. We do this to handle Linux systems
 2076: %% that use (for instance) 127.0.1.1 as the IP address for the hostname.
 2077: 
 2078: ip_member({127,_,_,_}, [{127,_,_,_}|_]) -> true;
 2079: ip_member(K, [K|_]) -> true;
 2080: ip_member(K, [_|T]) -> ip_member(K, T);
 2081: ip_member(_, []) -> false.
 2082: 
 2083: %% Case fold to upper case according to RFC 4343
 2084: %%
 2085: toupper([C|Cs]) when is_integer(C) ->
 2086:     if  $a =< C, C =< $z ->
 2087: 	    [(C - $a + $A)|toupper(Cs)];
 2088: 	true ->
 2089: 	    [C|toupper(Cs)]
 2090:     end;
 2091: toupper([]) ->
 2092:     [].
 2093: 
 2094: 
 2095: simple_netns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2096:     {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 2097:     case inet:setopts(U, [{netns,""}]) of
 2098: 	ok ->
 2099: 	    jog_netns_opt(U),
 2100: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2101: 	    %%
 2102: 	    {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 2103: 	    jog_netns_opt(L),
 2104: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2105: 	    %%
 2106: 	    case gen_sctp:open() of
 2107: 		{ok,S} ->
 2108: 		    jog_netns_opt(S),
 2109: 		    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2110: 		{error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2111: 		    ok
 2112: 	    end;
 2113: 	{error,einval} ->
 2114: 	    {skip,"setns() not supported"}
 2115:     end.
 2116: 
 2117: jog_netns_opt(S) ->
 2118:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 2119:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,""}]),
 2120:     {ok,[{netns,""}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 2121:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]),
 2122:     {ok,[{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 2123:     ok.
 2124: 
 2125: 
 2126: %% Smoke test netns support.
 2127: simple_netns_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2128:     %% Note: {error,enoent} will be returned if the run-time executable
 2129:     %%       has support for netns, but /proc/self/ns/net is missing.
 2130:     case gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2131: 	{ok,U} ->
 2132: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U);
 2133: 	{error,E1} when E1 =:= einval; E1 =:= eperm; E1 =:= enoent ->
 2134: 	    ok
 2135:     end,
 2136:     case gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2137: 	{ok,T} ->
 2138: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(T);
 2139: 	{error,E2} when E2 =:= einval; E2 =:= eperm; E2 =:= enoent ->
 2140: 	    ok
 2141:     end,
 2142:     try gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2143: 	{ok,S} ->
 2144: 	    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2145: 	{error,E3}
 2146: 	  when E3 =:= einval; E3 =:= eperm;
 2147: 	       E3 =:= enoent; E3 =:= eprotonosupport ->
 2148: 	    ok
 2149:     catch
 2150: 	error:badarg ->
 2151: 	    %% Some older platforms does not allow netns for sctp
 2152: 	    ok
 2153:     end.
 2154: 
 2155: 
 2156: %% Manual test to be run outside test_server in an emulator
 2157: %% started by root, in a machine with setns() support...
 2158: test_netns() ->
 2159:     DefaultIF = v1,
 2160:     DefaultIP = {192,168,1,17},
 2161:     Namespace = "test",
 2162:     NamespaceIF = v2,
 2163:     NamespaceIP = {192,168,1,18},
 2164:     %%
 2165:     DefaultIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(DefaultIP),
 2166:     NamespaceIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(NamespaceIP),
 2167:     cmd("ip netns add ~s",
 2168: 	[Namespace]),
 2169:     cmd("ip link add name ~w type veth peer name ~w netns ~s",
 2170:         [DefaultIF,NamespaceIF,Namespace]),
 2171:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 2172: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIPString,NamespaceIF]),
 2173:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip link set ~w up",
 2174: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIF]),
 2175:     cmd("ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 2176: 	[DefaultIPString,DefaultIF]),
 2177:     cmd("ip link set ~w up",
 2178: 	[DefaultIF]),
 2179:     try test_netns(
 2180: 	  {DefaultIF,DefaultIP},
 2181: 	  filename:join("/var/run/netns/", Namespace),
 2182: 	  {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) of
 2183: 	Result ->
 2184: 	    io:put_chars(["#### Test done",io_lib:nl()]),
 2185: 	    Result
 2186:     after
 2187: 	cmd("ip link delete ~w type veth",
 2188: 	    [DefaultIF]),
 2189: 	cmd("ip netns delete ~s",
 2190: 	    [Namespace])
 2191:     end.
 2192: 
 2193: test_netns({DefaultIF,DefaultIP}, Namespace, {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) ->
 2194:     {ok,ListenSocket} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 2195:     {ok,[{addr,DefaultIP}]} = inet:ifget(ListenSocket, DefaultIF, [addr]),
 2196:     {ok,ListenPort} = inet:port(ListenSocket),
 2197:     {ok,ConnectSocket} =
 2198: 	gen_tcp:connect(
 2199: 	  DefaultIP, ListenPort, [{active,false},{netns,Namespace}], 3000),
 2200:     {ok,[{addr,NamespaceIP}]} = inet:ifget(ConnectSocket, NamespaceIF, [addr]),
 2201:     {ok,ConnectPort} = inet:port(ConnectSocket),
 2202:     {ok,AcceptSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket, 0),
 2203:     {ok,AcceptPort} = inet:port(AcceptSocket),
 2204:     {ok,{NamespaceIP,ConnectPort}} = inet:peername(AcceptSocket),
 2205:     {ok,{DefaultIP,AcceptPort}} = inet:peername(ConnectSocket),
 2206:     ok = gen_tcp:send(ConnectSocket, "data"),
 2207:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ConnectSocket),
 2208:     {ok,"data"} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 4, 1000),
 2209:     {error,closed} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 1, 1000),
 2210:     ok = gen_tcp:close(AcceptSocket),
 2211:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket).
 2212: 
 2213: cmd(Cmd, Args) ->
 2214:     cmd(io_lib:format(Cmd, Args)).
 2215: %%
 2216: cmd(CmdString) ->
 2217:     io:put_chars(["# ",CmdString,io_lib:nl()]),
 2218:     io:put_chars([os:cmd(CmdString++" ; echo '  =>' $?")]),
 2219:     ok.
 2220: 
 2221: -define(CAP_NET_RAW, 13).        %% from /usr/include/linux/capability.h
 2222: 
 2223: can_bind_to_device({unix, linux}, {Major, _, _})
 2224:   when Major > 2 ->
 2225:     Status = os:cmd("cat /proc/self/status | grep CapEff"),
 2226:     [_, CapEffStr] = string:tokens(Status, [$\n, $\t]),
 2227:     CapEff = list_to_integer(CapEffStr, 16),
 2228:     if CapEff band (1 bsl ?CAP_NET_RAW) =/= 0 ->
 2229:             ok;
 2230:        true ->
 2231:             {skip,"insufficient capabilities, CAP_NET_RAW not granted"}
 2232:     end;
 2233: can_bind_to_device(_OS, _Version) ->
 2234:     {skip,"socket option bind_to_device not supported on this OS or version"}.
 2235: 
 2236: simple_bind_to_device(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2237:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 2238:         ok ->
 2239:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 2240:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(U),
 2241:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2242:             %%
 2243:             {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 2244:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(L),
 2245:             ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2246:             %%
 2247:             case gen_sctp:open() of
 2248:                 {ok,S} ->
 2249:                     jog_bind_to_device_opt(S),
 2250:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2251:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2252:                     ok
 2253:             end;
 2254:         Other ->
 2255:             Other
 2256:     end.
 2257: 
 2258: %% Smoke test bind_to_device support.
 2259: simple_bind_to_device_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2260:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 2261:         ok ->
 2262:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 2263:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2264:             {ok,T} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 2265:             ok = gen_tcp:close(T),
 2266: 
 2267:             case gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]) of
 2268:                 {ok,S} ->
 2269:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2270:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2271:                     ok
 2272:             end;
 2273:         Other ->
 2274:             Other
 2275:     end.
 2276: 
 2277: jog_bind_to_device_opt(S) ->
 2278:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 2279:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<>>}]),
 2280:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<>>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 2281:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]),
 2282:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 2283:     ok.

 2285: add_del_host(_Config) ->
 2286:     Name = "foo.com",
 2287:     Alias = "bar.org",
 2288:     Ip = {69,89,31,226},
 2289:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 2290:         h_name = Name,
 2291:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 2292:         h_addrtype = inet,
 2293:         h_length = 4,
 2294:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 2295:     },
 2296:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2297:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2298:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2299:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 2300:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 2301:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2302:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 2303:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2304:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet).
 2305: 
 2306: add_del_host_v6(_Config) ->
 2307:     Name = "foo.com",
 2308:     Alias = "bar.org",
 2309:     Ip = {32,1,219,8,10,11,18,240},
 2310:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 2311:         h_name = Name,
 2312:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 2313:         h_addrtype = inet6,
 2314:         h_length = 16,
 2315:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 2316:     },
 2317:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2318:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2319:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2320:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 2321:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 2322:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2323:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 2324:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2325:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6).

 2329: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2330: 
 2331: %%% This is a supremely simple test case.
 2332: %%% It basically just tests that the function (inet:socknames/1,2)
 2333: %%% returns with the expected result (a list of addresses, which in
 2334: %%% the case of tcp and udp should be exactly one address long).
 2335: 
 2336: socknames_sctp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2337:     %%% ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_socknames_sctp(Config) end).
 2338:     {skip, not_implemented_yet}.
 2339: 
 2340: 
 2341: socknames_tcp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2342:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2343:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2344:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2345:                             Addr;
 2346:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2347:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2348:                     end
 2349:            end,
 2350:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_tcp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2351:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2352:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2353: 
 2354: do_socknames_tcp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2355:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2356:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2357:     do_socknames_tcp1([], Addr),
 2358: 
 2359:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2360:     try socket:info() of
 2361:         #{} ->
 2362:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2363:             do_socknames_tcp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2364:     catch
 2365:         error:notsup ->
 2366:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2367:             ok;
 2368:         error:undef:ST ->
 2369:             case ST of
 2370:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2371:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2372:             end
 2373:     end.
 2374: 
 2375: 
 2376: do_socknames_tcp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2377:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2378:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2379:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2380: 
 2381:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 2382:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:listen(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2383:     ?P("try get socknames for (listen) socket: "
 2384:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2385:     PortNumber1 = case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2386: 		      {ok, [{_Addr1, PortNo1}]} ->
 2387: 			  PortNo1;
 2388: 		      {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2389:                           ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2390:                              "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2391: 			  exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2392: 		      {error, Reason1} ->
 2393:                           ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2394:                              "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2395: 			  exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2396: 		  end,
 2397:     ?P("try connect to listen socket on port ~p", [PortNumber1]),
 2398:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNumber1, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2399:     ?P("try get socknames for (connected) socket: "
 2400:        "~n      ~p", [S2]),
 2401:     case inet:socknames(S2) of
 2402: 	{ok, [_Addr2]} ->
 2403: 	    ok;
 2404: 	{ok, Addrs2} ->
 2405:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2406:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs2]),
 2407: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs2)});
 2408: 	{error, Reason2} ->
 2409:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2410:                "~n      ~p", [Reason2]),
 2411: 	    exit({skip, {connected_socket, Reason2}})
 2412:     end,
 2413:     ?P("try accept connection"),
 2414:     {ok, S3} = gen_tcp:accept(S1),
 2415:     ?P("try get socknames for (accepted) socket: "
 2416:        "~n      ~p", [S3]),
 2417:     case inet:socknames(S3) of
 2418: 	{ok, [_Addr3]} ->
 2419: 	    ok;
 2420: 	{ok, Addrs3} ->
 2421:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2422:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs3]),
 2423: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs3)});
 2424: 	{error, Reason3} ->
 2425:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2426:                "~n      ~p", [Reason3]),
 2427: 	    exit({skip, {accepted_socket, Reason3}})
 2428:     end,
 2429:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2430:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S3)),
 2431:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S2)),
 2432:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S1)),
 2433:     ?P("done"),
 2434:     ok.
 2435: 
 2436: 
 2437: socknames_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2438:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2439:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2440:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2441:                             Addr;
 2442:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2443:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2444:                     end
 2445:            end,
 2446:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_udp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2447:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2448:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2449: 
 2450: do_socknames_udp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2451:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2452:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2453:     do_socknames_udp1([], Addr),
 2454: 
 2455:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2456:     try socket:info() of
 2457:         #{} ->
 2458:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2459:             do_socknames_udp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2460:     catch
 2461:         error : notsup ->
 2462:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2463:             ok;
 2464:         error:undef:ST ->
 2465:             case ST of
 2466:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2467:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2468:             end
 2469:     end.
 2470: 
 2471: 
 2472: do_socknames_udp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2473:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2474:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2475:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2476: 
 2477:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2478:     {ok, S1} = gen_udp:open(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2479:     ?P("try get socknames for socket: "
 2480:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2481:     case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2482:         {ok, [_Addr1]} ->
 2483:             ok;
 2484:         {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2485:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2486:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2487:             exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2488:         {error, Reason1} ->
 2489:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2490:                "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2491:             exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2492:     end,
 2493:     ?P("enable debug"),
 2494:     inet:setopts(S1, [{debug, true}]),
 2495:     ?P("close socket"),
 2496:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 2497:     ?P("done"),
 2498:     ok.
 2499: 
 2500: 
 2501: 
 2502: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2503: 
 2504: links() ->
 2505:     pi(links).
 2506: 
 2507: monitors() ->
 2508:     pi(monitors).
 2509: 
 2510: pi(Item) ->
 2511:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 2512:     Val.
 2513:     
 2514:
